poem:
Title: "The Secret Hearth"

Eulogies woven in the threads of justice,
Three raven hearts beating in the cold North,
Lamentations echo through the snow-white hush,
In memory of Nijjar, in ancient words given back to Earth.

An eerie tale of audacity and guile,
Unraveled beneath the indifferent stars' trance.
Only the gurdwara's parking lot knows, 
The tragic dance of power and defiance.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Canadian police charge three over alleged assassination of Sikh activist Canadian police have charged three members of an alleged hit team for their role in the assassination of the Sikh activist Hardeep Singh Nijjar, the first arrests in a high-profile killing which officials believe was masterminded by India. The arrest, first reported by CBC News, comes nearly a year after the prominent activist was killed in the parking lot of his gurdwara in the city". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
